title: Series associated with a function defined as an integral

content.question: Let f be the function given by \(f\left(t\right)=\frac{4}{1+t^2}\) and G be the function given by \(G\left(x\right)=\int_0^xf\left(t\right)dt\). (a) Find the first four nonzero terms and the general term for the power series expansion of f(t) about t = 0.

frqParts.text: Let f be the function given by \(f\left(t\right)=\frac{4}{1+t^2}\) and G be the function given by \(G\left(x\right)=\int_0^xf\left(t\right)dt\). (a) Find the first four nonzero terms and the general term for the power series expansion of f(t) about t = 0.
(b) Find the first four nonzero terms and the general term for the power series expansion of G(x) about x = 0.
(c) Find the interval of convergence of the power series in part (b). (Your solution must include an analysis that justifies your answer.)

topic.text: 10.13: (BC ONLY) Radius and Interval of Convergence of Power Series

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Identify a re-expression of mathematical information presented in a given representation
